Notes: CTOL 5th-gen with AN/APG-81 AESA radar (200+ km detection), sensor fusion, and internal 4 AIM-120D/AAM-4B bays for stealthy BVR; EOTS-2 targeting and MADL/Link-16 enable cooperative kills with E-767 cueing to 160 km envelope; 42 operational across 3 squadrons (Komatsu, Misawa, etc.), with 105 more on order toward 147 total.

Upgraded 4.5-gen with AN/APG-82(V)1 AESA (250 km range), thrust-vectoring, and 8-12 AIM-120D pylons for high-volume BVR; J-MSIP mods add conformal tanks and datalink for sustained ops; core interceptor fleet, integrated with FPS-5 radars for 160 km effective range.

Dual-seat variant with same AN/APG-82 AESA and 6-8 AIM-120D loads as F-15J; supports advanced tactics training and operational BVR missions; licensed by Mitsubishi, with ongoing upgrades for AAM-4B compatibility and Link-16 fusion.

Enlarged F-16 derivative with J/APG-1 AESA (150 km), fly-by-wire, and 6 AIM-120C-7/AAM-4B missiles; excels in maritime strike/BVR with conformal loads; indigenous production by Mitsubishi, forming 4 squadrons for forward defense.

Tandem-seat version with identical J/APG-1 radar and 4-6 BVR missile capacity; enables two-ship tactics and EW training; supports networked cueing via E-2D for 130 km engagements in East China Sea ops.

AWACS with MESA AESA radar (400 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course AIM-120 updates; critical kill-chain enabler for F-35/F-15 salvos; all 4 operational at Hamamatsu AB, upgraded in 2024 for IFF Mode 5.

Carrier-incompatible but land-based AEW with APS-145 radar (400 km) and CEC for cooperative BVR; 4 E-2C upgraded to D standard by 2025, plus 9 new-builds IOC; No. 31st Sqdn provides persistent coverage for Typhoon Strait.
MRTT with boom/receptacle refueling for 2+ hour BVR extensions on F-15J/F-35A; remote vision system enhances ops; 4 delivered by Nov 2025 (2 more on order), replacing KC-767 for Pacific sustainment.
